> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

| [Impacted Files](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1515?src=pr&el=tree) | Coverage Δ | |
|---|---|---|
| [auto\_tests/toxav\_many\_test.c](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1515/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-YXV0b190ZXN0cy90b3hhdl9tYW55X3Rlc3QuYw==) | `93.20% <0.00%> (-3.71%)` | :arrow_down: |
| [toxcore/TCP\_server.c](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1515/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-dG94Y29yZS9UQ1Bfc2VydmVyLmM=) | `80.04% <0.00%> (-2.77%)` | :arrow_down: |
| [toxcore/TCP\_client.c](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1515/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-dG94Y29yZS9UQ1BfY2xpZW50LmM=) | `62.17% <0.00%> (-2.60%)` | :arrow_down: |
| [toxcore/LAN\_discovery.c](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1515/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-dG94Y29yZS9MQU5fZGlzY292ZXJ5LmM=) | `83.96% <0.00%> (-0.95%)` | :arrow_down: |
| [toxcore/net\_crypto.c](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1515/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-dG94Y29yZS9uZXRfY3J5cHRvLmM=) | `93.58% <0.00%> (-0.92%)` | :arrow_down: |
| [toxcore/friend\_connection.c](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1515/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-dG94Y29yZS9mcmllbmRfY29ubmVjdGlvbi5j) | `94.03% <0.00%> (-0.29%)` | :arrow_down: |

------

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1515?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1515?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [8f4400b...3d601fe](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1515?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

It breaks the alignment in some cases by removing what it thinks are redundant spaces :\

Also CI fails, autotools-linux can't find nacl.

Still fails. Looks like it's passing configure options as arguments to make.

```
make: unrecognized option '--with-nacl-headers=/home/travis/cache/include/amd64'
make: unrecognized option '--disable-ipv6'
make: unrecognized option '--enable-nacl'
make: unrecognized option '--enable-daemon'
make: unrecognized option '--enable-logging'
make: unrecognized option '--with-log-level=TRACE'
```
Also, don't really like this change. Can we keep the formatting as it is? Aside from whatever shellcheck suggests to fix.
Clearly I don't know bash :) fixed now.
Regarding disabling formatters: I'd rather accept some slightly not-so-nice formatting in favour of automatised and consistent formatting.

>Clearly I don't know bash :)

Bash arrays are PIA to use and make the code less readable as not many know how to use them. Not sure why you even bothered changing `CONFIG_FLAGS` from a string to an array if the string solution worked, but oh well.
